author: 小浪财讯
title: 科创医药ETF（588860）涨1.27%，半日成交额1569.40万元|ETF_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
7月31日，截止午间收盘，科创医药ETF（588860）涨1.27%，报1.589元，成交额1569.40万元。科创医药ETF（588860）重仓股方面， 联影医疗 截止午盘跌0.18%， 百济神州 涨0.31%， 惠泰医疗 涨1.26%， 百利天恒 跌2.34%， 艾力斯 涨0.42%， 泽璟制药 跌1.34%， 君实生物 涨0.92%， 博瑞医药 跌1.44%， 华大智造 涨1.92%， 益方生物 涨6.64%。
科创医药ETF（588860）业绩比较基准为 上证科创板生物医药指数 收益率，管理人为工银瑞信基金管理有限公司，基金经理为史宝珖，成立（2024-08-08）以来回报为57.19%，近一个月回报为16.09%。
风险提示：市场有风险，投资需谨慎。本文为AI大模型自动发布，任何在本文出现的信息（包括但不限于个股、评论、预测、图表、指标、理论、任何形式的表述等）均只作为参考，不构成个人投资建议。

author: Escrito por Meon
title: RMVale em alerta para temporais no fim de semana
text:
O Vale do Paraíba e regiões próximas devem se preparar para um fim de semana marcado por chuvas intensas e quedas de temperatura. De acordo com o Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais (Inpe), uma área de baixa pressão atmosférica, formada entre o Rio Grande do Sul e o Uruguai, está avançando em direção ao Sudeste e deve atingir o estado de São Paulo já nesta sexta-feira (13).
Apesar de o dia ter começado com céu aberto em várias cidades, como Taubaté, o cenário deve mudar nas próximas horas. A instabilidade no clima será intensificada no sábado (14), com previsão de pancadas de chuva ao longo do dia e risco de temporais, segundo o portal especializado Climatempo.
As temperaturas também serão impactadas. Nesta sexta-feira (13), os termômetros podem atingir máximas de 31ºC em cidades como Taubaté, mas no sábado (14), a máxima não deve passar de 26ºC. A mesma tendência é esperada para São José dos Campos e o Litoral Norte, onde o tempo deve permanecer instável até domingo (15).
Moradores e autoridades estão em alerta para possíveis alagamentos e transtornos causados pelas chuvas intensas. A recomendação é evitar áreas de risco e prestar atenção às atualizações meteorológicas ao longo do fim de semana.
Defesa Civil alerta para chuva forte nos próximos dias
Há previsão de raios e ventos
"Chuva preta" registra presença no Rio Grande do Sul: Entenda o fenômeno.
Parte de morro desliza sobre casarões históricos de Ouro Preto (MG)
Não há registro de vítimas até o momento; edifícios haviam sido tombados por terem valor histórico

author: Video Editor
title: Don't sign an RV contract until you see this
text:
By Cheri Sicard
Buying an RV should be an exciting adventure, not a financial trap. Sadly, some RV dealerships use tactics that can leave customers with a bad deal.
In the video below, Deb from Deb’s RV Services, a certified RV inspector and registered technician, is here to warn consumers about these practices. This post will cover what to watch out for before signing on the dotted line.
It’s important to know what to look for when buying an RV. Some dealerships may try to take advantage of unsuspecting buyers. Here are two common issues Deb has seen during her inspections:
1. Outdated tires on brand-new RVs
2. Pressuring customers to sign contracts before repairs are completed
Tactic #1: Outdated tires—Are you getting ripped off?
Have you ever bought something new, only to find out a key part was already old? That’s what’s happening with some RV tires. (It’s not just RVs. CarMax did the same thing when I bought my truck, something I learned the hard way after an explosive blowout.)
Dealerships are selling brand-new RVs with tires that are already two or more years old. Why is this a problem? RV tires typically need to be replaced every five to six years. So, if you buy an RV with older tires, you’re starting with a reduced lifespan. Depending on the size and brand, RV tires can cost hundreds of dollars each. Buying an RV with older tires means you’ll have to shell out more money sooner than expected.
How can you tell if the RV you’re eyeing has old tires? Look for the DOT code on the tire’s sidewall. This code includes the week and year the tire was manufactured. For example, a DOT code ending in “2422” means the tire was made in the 24th week of 2022. If you’re buying an RV in late 2024 and the tires are dated 2022 or earlier, that’s a red flag.
RV inspectors will include the tire date on their report. However, they usually can’t advise you to replace the tires if they’re within the manufacturer’s acceptable age range. So, what can you do? Use the tire age as a negotiating tool. If the tires are already a couple of years old, ask the dealership for a discount on the RV’s price. This can help offset the cost of replacing the tires sooner.
Keep in mind that not all tires are created equal. Cheaper brands may not last as long as higher-quality tires. This is another factor to consider when negotiating with the dealership. If the RV has older tires from a less reputable brand, it strengthens your case for a price reduction.
Tactic #2: Signed, sealed, delivered… but not fixed
Imagine buying a house, only to find out after you’ve signed the papers that the roof leaks. That’s similar to what can happen when dealerships pressure customers to sign RV contracts before repairs are completed.
Many RV buyers get an inspection to make sure everything is in good working order before they commit to the purchase. They want to hit the road with confidence, knowing their RV is ready for adventure. However, some dealerships try to rush the process. They pressure buyers to sign the contract before addressing the issues found during the inspection. This defeats the purpose of the inspection and can leave buyers stuck with an RV that needs repairs.
Here’s how it often plays out: The customer arranges for an inspection, and the inspector sends the report to the customer and the dealership. The dealership might then say, “We’ll take care of those repairs. Just sign the contract now.”
They might use tactics like claiming it’s the end of the month and they can’t guarantee the price if the customer doesn’t sign immediately. Deb strongly disagrees with this approach, calling it “BS.”
The best way to protect yourself is simple: Don’t sign the contract until after all repairs have been completed and you’ve personally verified them. Stand firm and don’t let the dealership bully you into signing before you’re ready. It’s your right to ensure the RV is in good condition before you commit to buying it.
Buying an RV is a big decision. By being informed and proactive, you can avoid common dealership tactics and ensure you get a fair deal. Ask questions, do your research, and don’t be afraid to walk away if something doesn’t feel right.
Have you experienced these tactics? Share your stories in the comments below!
RELATED

author: Juan Castillo
title: Calor veraniego: en esta región de Chile se registrarán 30 grados hoy viernes 11 de octubre
text: Calor veraniego: en esta región de Chile se registrarán 30 grados hoy viernes 11 de octubre Por esta situación, la Dirección Meteorológica de Chile (DMC) emitió un aviso por evento de altas temperaturas. Revisa también Con una mínima por sobre los 11 grados, pero con cielos cubiertos, comenzó este viernes 11 de octubre [en Santiago](https://www.adnradio.cl/tag/santiago_de_chile/a/), jornada que se mantendrá nublada gran parte del día. Sin embargo, la [Dirección Meteorológica de Chile (DMC)](https://www.meteochile.gob.cl/PortalDMC-web/index.xhtml) emitió un aviso por evento de altas temperaturas en una región de Chile, donde las máximas podrían llegar hasta los 30 grados. En esta región de Chile se registrarán 30 grados hoy viernes 11 de octubre Según el aviso de la DMC, este evento de altas temperaturas se registrará durante toda esta jornada en la Región de Atacama, en los sectores del litoral, cordillera costa, sectores de valles y pampa. Mientras que el pronóstico del tiempo señala que en localidades como El Salvador o Huasco las máximas rondarán entre los 25 y 26 grados, en tanto, en zonas como Freirina o Vallenar, los termómetros podrían marcar incluso 30° C. - El Salvador: 26° C - Chañaral: 19° C - Caldera: 20° C - Copiapó: 28° C - Huasco: 25° C - Freirina: 29° C - Vallenar: 30° C [Podcasts recomendados](https://www.adnradio.cl/podcast/) [Ver todos](https://www.adnradio.cl/podcast/) [El código Mccartney](/audio/d7603fef-bd9b-4ca6-b62c-b20600a471c6/)Hoy - 18:50 [Suscríbete](/podcast/el-codigo-mccartney/2097d837-9e18-5e9f-aed1-bee6afb59fd7/)[Suscríbete](/podcast/los-tenores-de-adn/636a5307-ad69-5137-a879-652bb485950d/)[Suscríbete](/podcast/adn-hoy/0af1fa9c-adaf-5bf2-8972-45602b7a871f/)[Suscríbete](/podcast/una-pausa-necesaria/9b246ab0-4229-59b5-9215-b3c67fb7283e/)[Día de acusaciones constitucionales](/audio/b556bccf-e06c-4a51-bb7d-b20500e43d5c/)Ayer - 46:37 [Suscríbete](/podcast/pais-adn/318def40-7671-5aef-af8d-690a11f66083/)[¿Cómo evitamos el stress laboral?](/audio/1573bbc4-d790-4176-8ccf-b2020102762a/)07/10/24 - 23:12 [Suscríbete](/podcast/salud-mental-en-ciudadano-adn/0eb17476-be4d-590e-afb5-d61842f1a3d6/)[Se abre la opción de crédito hipotecario a 40 años](/audio/a89733bf-a34f-4dfa-8609-b201011b7a42/)07/10/24 - 39:38 [Suscríbete](/podcast/tus-finanzas-familiares/469c6c4c-d1f8-5b54-8536-e2d81ad42250/)[Festival Chile Jazz, capítulo 3](/audio/eb99ff6a-5c54-4ee1-8fcd-b20200fa1d9d/)07/10/24 - 49:46 [Suscríbete](/podcast/festival-chile-jazz-2024-edicion-10o-/3b0d5f10-7834-5df2-b2b8-efc95cb41dd3/)

author: @UnioneSarda
title: Sala prelievi chiusa per le feste  - L'Unione Sarda.it
text:
Il Natale non porta buone notizie per il presidio ospedaliero. La sala prelievi del Nostra Signora della Mercede chiude sotto le feste. Le giornate nere sono quelle del 21, 24, 27, 28 e 31 dicembre, e il sabato 4 gennaio. Il personale in laboratorio scarseggia e sotto Natale, per consentire il recupero psicofisico dei pochi professionisti presenti, la sala prelievi rimarrà chiusa.
L’emergenza
La Asl, attraverso una comunicazione firmata dal direttore sanitario del presidio, specifica che le prestazioni in emergenza-urgenza saranno comunque garantite. In laboratorio analisi, una malattia improvvisa di un dirigente ha lasciato due biologi e due medici a gestire tutto il carico di lavoro. Da tempo il personale in organico è riuscito a garantire il servizio attraverso le solite prestazioni aggiuntive, ma quattro professionisti sono troppo pochi per coprire tutti i turni, per cui si è reso necessario ridurre il carico di lavoro e tenere aperto a giorni alterni, pur garantendo le emergenze. Aurelia Orecchioni, della Uil Fpl, ha commentato: «Massima attenzione e monitoraggio per la situazione del laboratorio analisi in grave sofferenza per la mancanza di dirigenti medici. La sofferenza dura da mesi, sappiamo che in Ares esiste una graduatoria concorsuale, e il 21 dicembre scadono i termini di un bando per biologi indetto dalla nostra Asl. Non crediamo che sia sufficiente, per il riposo psicofisico del personale, chiudere la sala prelievi, sollecitiamo una immediata soluzione anche chiedendo se necessario la collaborazione di altre Asl». Intanto, la notizia è arrivata a Cagliari che, informata del problema, si sta muovendo per provare a trovare una soluzione.
Il ricordo
In questi giorni ricorre l’anniversario della scomparsa di Maurizio Ennas, ortopedico cagliaritano che ha avuto un ruolo fondamentale nella ricostruzione del reparto di Lanusei, dal 2021 in avanti. «Maurizio era una colonna portante della nostra struttura - racconta Luigi Soddu, direttore dell’Ortopedia del Nostra Signora della Mercede - era meticoloso e preciso, ed era una supporto importantissimo durante gli interventi». Grazie al suo apporto, alcuni professionisti hanno deciso di rimanere in Ogliastra a lavorare. «L’ospedale e l’Ogliastra gli devono tanto», conclude Soddu.
RIPRODUZIONE RISERVATA

author: Enviroliteracy Team
title: Where not to buy salmon?
text:
Where Not to Buy Salmon: A Smart Consumer’s Guide The world of salmon can be surprisingly complex. What was once a simple decision at the grocery store has become a minefield of ethical and environmental considerations. The truth is, where you buy your salmon is just as important as what you buy. Making informed choices helps protect our oceans, supports sustainable practices, and, ultimately, ensures you’re getting a healthier product. In short, you should avoid purchasing farmed Atlantic salmon from Canada, Chile, Norway, or Scotland, unless it is ASC-certified, comes from a Good Alternative source, or is from businesses committed to sustainable seafood . Additionally, regardless of certifications, you should avoid open-net pen farmed salmon because most farmed salmon at your local grocer, seafood store or restaurant is likely from an open-net pen in Canada, Iceland, Norway, or Chile .
Understanding the Salmon Landscape: Wild vs. Farmed Before we delve into specific retailers, it’s crucial to understand the fundamental difference between wild-caught and farmed salmon . This distinction is at the heart of many ethical and environmental concerns.
Wild-caught salmon , primarily Pacific salmon species (like sockeye, coho, pink, chum, and Chinook ), are caught in their natural habitats. The health of these populations directly reflects the health of their ecosystems. Farmed salmon , most commonly Atlantic salmon , are raised in contained environments. The practices used in these farms can have significant environmental and health implications. The Problem with Open-Net Pen Farming The open-net pen system is the most common type of salmon farming, and it’s also the most problematic. These pens, submerged in coastal waters, allow for the free exchange of water – and everything else – between the farm and the surrounding environment. Here’s why they’re a concern:
Pollution: Fish waste, uneaten feed, and antibiotics pollute surrounding waters, harming local ecosystems. Disease and Parasites: Cramped conditions promote the spread of diseases and parasites, like sea lice, which can decimate wild salmon populations. Escapes: Farmed salmon can escape from these pens and interbreed with wild populations, diluting the genetic diversity and resilience of wild stocks. Retailers and Regions to Approach with Caution While absolute “avoidance” might be difficult, being aware of certain retailers and regions known for relying on problematic farming practices is crucial.
Generic Salmon from Unspecified Sources: If the origin of the salmon isn’t clearly labeled, it’s best to avoid it. Lack of transparency is a red flag. Discount Retailers Prioritizing Price Over Sustainability: While not always the case, some discount retailers may source salmon from farms with lower environmental standards to keep costs down. Do your research! Restaurants with Vague Sourcing Practices: Don’t hesitate to ask your server where their salmon comes from. If they can’t provide a clear answer, consider ordering something else. Canada, Chile, Norway, and Scotland are major salmon farming regions, and while some farms adhere to best practices, many rely on open-net pen systems. Look for certifications! Making Informed Choices: What to Look For So, how can you be a responsible salmon consumer? Here are some key indicators of sustainably sourced salmon:
Certifications: Look for certifications like Aquaculture Stewardship Council (ASC) . These certifications indicate that the farm meets specific environmental and social standards. Closed Containment Systems: Opt for salmon raised in closed containment systems on land. These systems minimize environmental impact by preventing the release of waste and disease into surrounding waters. Origin: Favor wild-caught Alaskan salmon . Alaska has some of the strictest fisheries management practices in the world. Transparency: Support retailers and restaurants that are transparent about their sourcing practices. You can also consult resources like seafoodwatch.org, run by the Monterey Bay Aquarium, or enviroliteracy.org to research seafood sustainability. The Environmental Literacy Council is a good resource for learning more.
Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) About Buying Salmon 1. Is it always better to buy wild-caught salmon? Generally, yes. Wild-caught salmon , particularly from well-managed fisheries like those in Alaska , is a more sustainable and often healthier choice. However, it’s essential to be aware of potential mercury contamination in larger, older fish.
2. Is farmed salmon always bad? Not necessarily. Farmed salmon can be a responsible choice if it’s raised using sustainable practices, such as in closed containment systems . Look for certifications and be aware of the origin.
3. What does “ASC-certified” mean? ASC certification indicates that the salmon farm has met specific environmental and social standards set by the Aquaculture Stewardship Council . This includes minimizing pollution, reducing the use of antibiotics, and ensuring fair labor practices.
4. Is all Alaskan salmon wild-caught? Yes, all salmon harvested commercially in Alaska is wild-caught . Alaska has a constitutional mandate to manage its fisheries sustainably.
5. What are the different types of Pacific salmon, and which is best? The main types of Pacific salmon are sockeye, coho, pink, chum, and Chinook (King) . Chinook is often considered the best tasting due to its high-fat content, but sockeye is also highly prized for its rich flavor and vibrant color. All are healthy and nutritious options.
6. Is Costco salmon a good choice? Costco sells both farmed and wild-caught salmon . Always read the label carefully to determine the origin and farming practices. Look for wild-caught Alaskan salmon or ASC-certified farmed salmon .
7. Is Trader Joe’s salmon sustainably sourced? Trader Joe’s carries both wild-caught and farmed salmon . Their wild Alaskan salmon is generally considered a good choice. Pay attention to the labels and look for sustainability certifications.
8. Is Aldi salmon a responsible choice? Aldi’s fresh salmon is typically farm-raised in Chile, Russia, or Norway . The sustainability of this salmon may vary. Research the specific sourcing practices and look for certifications.
9. What is the healthiest salmon to eat? Generally, wild-caught Pacific salmon is considered the healthiest due to its higher nutrient density and lower levels of contaminants. Alaskan salmon is an especially good choice.
10. Why is farmed salmon often pink or red? Farmed salmon is often fed a diet containing astaxanthin , a pigment that gives their flesh a pink or red color. This is done to mimic the natural coloration of wild salmon , which obtain astaxanthin from their diet of crustaceans.
11. Is it safe to eat salmon every day? While salmon is a healthy food, eating it every day might not be ideal. The FDA recommends two to three servings of fish per week to balance the benefits of omega-3 fatty acids with potential exposure to contaminants.
12. What are the risks of eating too much salmon? Eating large amounts of salmon can expose you to higher levels of mercury and other environmental contaminants. It’s important to vary your diet and choose lower-mercury options when possible.
13. What is the best way to cook salmon? Salmon can be cooked in many ways, including baking, grilling, pan-frying, and poaching. The best method depends on your personal preference and the type of salmon you’re cooking.
14. How can I tell if salmon is fresh? Fresh salmon should have a vibrant color (bright pink for farmed, dark pink for wild), a firm texture, and a fresh, sea-like smell. Avoid salmon with a dull color, a slimy texture, or a strong, fishy odor.
15. Is frozen salmon as healthy as fresh salmon? Frozen salmon can be just as healthy as fresh salmon, as long as it’s properly frozen and stored. Freezing can preserve the nutrients and prevent spoilage.

author: @podnews
title: Spotify Introduces New Solutions for Advertisers that Transform Buying, Measurement & Creativity
text:
Spotify Introduces New Solutions for Advertisers that Transform Buying, Measurement & Creativity
Note: These are notes we’ve been sent from the PR team; there doesn’t appear to be a press release.
Today at Spotify Advance, we’re unveiling the next phase of Spotify Advertising. We’ve upgraded our ad tech, expanded partnerships, and deepened our expertise to make it easier for advertisers to **buy, create, and measure campaigns with clear results.
This marks a major leap in automated buying and creative innovation—highlighted by the newSpotify Ad Exchange and Spotify Gen AI Ads—giving advertisers fresh, easy ways to tap into Spotify’s unique blend of culture, tech, and creativity.
Here are our Key Announcements:
- We’re modernizing our ad platform to give advertisers the flexibility to buy Spotify in the way that works best for them: the brand new Spotify Ad Exchange and our self-serve Spotify Ads Manager.
-
Spotify Ad Exchange (SAX): Our new programmatic offering. For the first time, advertisers can now access Spotify’s engaged, logged-in users via real-time auction with full addressability and measurement capabilities in whatever way works best for them. Beginning today, in addition to The Trade Desk, the Spotify Ad Exchange is now available via Google’s Display & Video 360 and Magnite, with Yahoo DSP, Adform, and many more to come soon. These partners now have access to our suite of audio, video, and display formats across music, with podcasts coming soon. SAX is now available to advertisers across US, Canada, Europe, Australia, New Zealand, India, Singapore, Brazil, and Mexico.
-
Spotify Ads Manager: We’re continuing to innovate our self-serve platform with more advanced targeting capabilities, new 1P & 3P measurement solutions, and new outcome-based objectives to help advertisers of all sizes create, optimize, and measure their Spotify campaigns, including Spotify Pixel, Custom Audiences, key third-party partnerships and a new App Installs objective.
- We’re making it easier than ever for advertisers to create with Spotify.
- Spotify Gen AI Ads: We’re bringing our decades-long AI expertise and innovative approach to our advertising partners to enable them to create scripts and voiceovers at no additional cost, making it easier than ever to create high-quality, scalable audio ads. Gen AI Ads are available to advertisers in the U.S. and Canada in Spotify Ads Manager.
- Spotify Creative Lab: Our dedicated team of creative minds work collaboratively with brands and agencies to inspire and scale creativity and to build unique and effective campaigns made just for the Spotify platform. Our Creative Lab team has helped brands create first-of-its-kind Spotify experiences, like Bestie Mode with Coca-Cola and Oreo, American Express and Resy’s Music Taste campaign, and the ‘100 Years of Chevrolet’ in Brazil.
- Spotify AUX: Our in-house consultancy brings together our unrivaled know-how in music, podcasts, culture, experiential, and content production to bridge the worlds of brands, artists, creators, and fandom. Our mission is to provide innovative solutions that elevate brands through the power of music and culture.
- Today, we’re thrilled to welcome two partners to the AUX family, Visa and Kona Big Wave. We’re also continuing our multi-year partnership with Coca-Cola. We’re partnering with Visa to address artists’ evolving needs as entrepreneurs and business owners. And together with Kona, we’re creating live experiences that amplify their storytelling during tentpole moments and solidify their place in culture.
- We’re helping advertisers reach their goals on Spotify with new measurement tools built just for Spotify and new 3P partnerships: We’ve rebuilt our first-party measurement stack and expanded tools with key third-party partnerships, enabling advertisers to evaluate performance across the funnel.
- New Lower-Funnel Objectives: Starting today, our new App Installs Objectiveenables advertisers to show ads to people likely to click and download their app, while our new Website Traffic Objective enables advertisers to optimize their campaign towards people most likely to view their website.
- Measurement Solutions: We’ve updated Spotify Brand Lift, our 1P measurement tool that helps advertisers understand how their Spotify campaigns impact their brand metrics. We’re also bringing Spotify Brand Lift and Spotify Pixel to Ads Manager Lastly, we’re investing in key 3P partnerships, such as DoubleVerify and IAS for Ads Manager, and adopting The Trade Desk Unified ID 2.0, LiveRamp’s RampID, and Google’s Display & Video 360’s PAIR for SAX to offer greater measurement capabilities and ensure that Spotify can be a trusted partner in this ever-evolving landscape.
Topline Stats:
Business Growth:
- We’ve accomplished Spotify’s first full year of profitability by growing our total revenues 20% YoY, while operating more nimbly and profitably and driving what we call sustainable growth (1).
- Our ad revenue has more than doubled since 2020 with significant yearly gains, driven primarily by brand advertising. (141% increase in ad revenue since 2020) (2).
- Today, we work with tens of thousands of advertisers. As we move down the funnel to offer more performance-based advertising and increase our appeal to video-first advertisers, we believe we have the opportunity to serve many more multiples of advertisers in the near future. (3).
- Automated channels drive $2 billion in ad spending with digital audio in 2025 (4).
- Automated planning and buying has become the industry default — accounting for over90% of US digital display dollars (5).
- Since we launched our pilot last year, we’ve seen over 5,000 advertisers jump in to test (6).
- Spotify Ads Manager revenue grew more than 50% YOY Q4’24 (13).
Spotify Advertising:
- 675 million users in 184 markets around the world trust Spotify to give them an unmatched experience every time they tap in (7). And over 90% of them say Spotify is essential to their daily life (8).
- Spotify is the #1 most home-screened app (9).
- Video consumption on Spotify is exploding. In fact, in-focus time is up 44% YoY in the US (10).
- On the ads side, we’ve found that combining audio and video ads increases purchase intent by 27% and incremental sales by 66% compared to audio alone (11).
- As we’ve rolled out AI Ads, we’re already seeing that when advertisers choose to produce an audio ad with Spotify Ads Manager’s creative tools, 40% of them are already choosing to do so with our AI Ad tool (12).

organizations.name: Spotify Introduces New Solutions for Advertisers

author: Daja Clayton
title: Marion Senior Services helping senior citizens during hurricane season
text: GAINESVILLE, Fla. (WCJB) - Storms are brewing as hurricane season kicked off earlier this month. Some organizations are using this time to prepare for what’s to come. Marion Senior Services has started its food drive to keep seniors fed and safe during the season. They usually have food items prepared for seniors, but they’re trying to get a headstart on what’s to come in the following months. “We find that seniors are left alone and without food,” said Tamara Grant-Powell, Finance Director. “And knowing that during the hurricane season, we usually have loss of power, energy, things like that. We wanted to make sure that our seniors are equipped and have the food on hand needed.” The Director of Human Services says they sometimes meet senior citizens when it’s almost too late. “Often times we find individuals that are at a point of crisis so having food on hand to help and serve an immediate need is very helpful.” said Briana Kelley. Marion Senior Services also provides seniors with emergency kits that consist of a bucket, flashlights, sanitary wipes, and other items that can last for at least a week. The food drive will last throughout the entirety of hurricane season. For more information on the drive, click here . Click here to subscribe to our newsletter. Copyright 2024 WCJB. All rights reserved.
